intro: Euphrasia randii var. reeksii, commonly known as the Reeksii eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses.
